channel.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
channel.description:
Hi, Me and a friend have idea's on creating a mmorpg.. But we dont know how to go about it. I'm currently taking java classes at school and xhtml. Our budget is arround £50-100 at the moment & time to spend working onit is arround 3+ years. Were willing to put arround 6 hour minimum per day.
If you could give us some advise or links to websites that talk about this. - Thanks.

item.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“XxJtxX, post:20, topic:396512”][quote author=Frell link=topic=493683.msg3612509#msg3612509 date=1306705976]
Not an mmorpg worth playing. Shit like maple story yea…
[/quote]I wonder how much money maple story makes for a shit game?[/quote]
Enough to be successful, but remaking a shit game will promise you barely any revenue.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

When you finish both of those classes you’ll realize that what you’re attempting will be way over your budget. Here it would be around $1,000 to $5,000 to start something decent. You’ll need way more people with experience than this forum will ever offer you. If you really want to develop an mmorpg try waiting until college or at least until you have time and people to work on that.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:14, topic:396512”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=493683.msg3612581#msg3612581 date=1306709860]

Not an mmorpg worth playing. Shit like maple story yea…
[/quote]Depends on what you’re liking. There are many AWESOME flash games out there that could make AWESOME MMORPG’s. I understand that your the type of person that supports graphics. But we flash developers are getting a HUGE new update. Flash player 11 is coming and there are beta versions already out there. Basicly, we get hardware accelerated 3D in flash and we get about 10 inbuilt 3D API’s wich allows us to make flash games looks like world of warcraft.

Flash is shit. Face it.[/quote]No it’s not, you are shit. With flash you can make websites, apllications, games, iphone apps, android apps. FLASH IS REVOLUTION.

item.source: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)

item.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

Ok guys, I don’t see what you are saying here. I started a project last year, to build a simple flash game, I had a general idea and I wanted to make that. I did not have ANY knowledge of ActionScript 3 whatsoever. So after 7 months of HARD work, writing the game, designing the game, making the sound effects. It ended up pretty nicely with a complete economical system, items in the shop based on what level you are, different types of weapons and I never exepted it to be like that. I also have a working highscore system and an income source from the game with ingame ads. It took me that long because I was learning the language as I was making the game. First it was how to get basic movement. Then couple of months later, I was learning basic PHP for being able to store highscore data on a MySQL database. Now, after those 7 months, I’d make the same game in 3 weeks time. I don’t need any tutorials anymore for creating applications on flash. The most important part of this process was: DON’T COPY AND PASTE,
but try to understand the code, try to understand what it says, in the beginning it will be hard but evantually you’ll understand it. It might take long, but in the end you will have advanced knowlegde of several languages.

So I’d say, if you have a team that is SERIOUS and it willing to create a real MMORPG and work on it for 6 hours a day. Then damn, I’d go for it.

Read full topic

item.source: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)

item.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I wouldn’t say don’t try it or anything related; if you’re willing to actually give this a shot, why not? Either it will be a waste of time, or it’ll pay off eventually. It’s not likely to actually make it, but if you do, it will seriously be worth it. Three, or more, years is a great time-frame for creating an MMORPG, and if you actually make it, use that. Who knows, maybe eventually you could make your own company such as Jagex, Blizzard, EA Games, etc.

Though 100 euros won’t get the dedicated server for an MMORPG, maybe you could get a job and save up adding money to your bank account and add some funds to a credit card and get a great dedicated server for a few hundred players to get on. Since MMORPG grows rapidly, even a dedicated server that costs a few thousand a month may not be enough for rapidly growing communities that MMORPG tend to have. But that would be great because of all the donations, and get more donations for a better dedicated server; fantastic.

If you do pull this off, that’s great! I do hope this works out for you, much luck to you, sir; you will be needing it.

Read full topic
item.source: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)

item.title: Creating a massive multiplayer online roll playing game (MMOPRG)
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

Frell:

dont waste your money or time

^ Best said.

It really is a waste of time to make a MMORPG with no experience, because at the end of the day when you look at what you’ve done, afterwards looking at another persons project, all you will be able to say to yourself is, “What is this piece of shit I just put together?”. You’ll then proceed to rewrite it again and again.

Experience given, I have rewritten my MMO five times, and I think (hope) this’ll be the last time. However, thats how I learned to code efficiently, so…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Creating a MMORPG without any schooling (collage or higher) and without a team of dedicated coders on staff would take many months if not years. You should consider some higher schooling before trying this.
